author: @TheHullahopp
text: Hi, I am totally confused by the abbreviation of SSR. On other websides this is used as Sum of Squared or Regression, but in your ppt, this is the Sum of Squared Residuals. So these are totally opposing definitions of SSR. (In regression there is the SST = SSR + SSE, where the SSE is the definiton of observed minus predicted; therefore this "amount" of error is need to be low). Am I correct? (You mention the SSE on page 63; which could be a "new" SSR by prediction line?)

author: @vtphan2012
text: I just bought the PDF version. It looks great. Worth the money.  Although there's a claim that the book covers everything from basic to advanced topics, I think the addition of a few important topics (for which you already have videos) would make it even better.  These include: (1) bias variance trade off, (2) k-nearest neighbors, (3) random forest, (4) AdaBoost, and (5) K-means clustering.  Most of these are quite fundamental.   Great book, overall. But could be greater :-)
